column4: anyone know about my old ATI card? I don't know what driver to use, as the proprietary won't help me; my card's too old.
Old radeons use the driver 'radeon' not any of the fgl ones.
will that give me 3d?
Yep.
Well, it did for me.  YMMV.
It doesn't work for all radeons, though.  What is yours?
You need the xserver-xorg-video-ati package to get the radeon driver.\
You might have to edit the xorg.conf yourself.
thats no problem. i could have done this a million times for nvidia :)
that package was not found. is it in non-free?
Hmm.  I'm pretty sure it's free.  maybe the name is off.
I'm showing it being called "xserver-xorg-video-ati" and it's got the little ubuntu icon, and was installed on my system despite not needing it (I bet it's automatic)
how would i check?
I'd probably go 'sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg-video-ati'.  It'll tell you if you have it and get it if you don't.
is that available in breezy? the only references to that are on Edgy and I have not upgraded this box there yet,
oh, I didn't think about that!  It's xserver-xorg-driver-ati for you.
this will give me 3d? i only get ~200fps in glxgears
I think so.  I'm sure using the radeon driver is a necessary step to getting 3d.
What's it say?
what is it that you want to know? what does it say where
When you try to run 'sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg-video-ati' and 'sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg-driver-ati'
"xserver-xorg-driver-ati is already the newest version."
Go into your xorg.conf and change your driver line to radeon
